question_sentence: Which Republican candidate dropped out of the 2024 US presidential race last weekend?
evidence: After languishing at the bottom of the polls and struggling to raise money for his campaign, the former vice president suspended his bid for the top job, announcing at the annual Republican Jewish Coalition convention: "It's become clear to me it's not my time."

question_sentence: Which unlikely creature did Hollywood actor Goldie Hawn claim "touched my face"?
evidence: The Oscar winner said she was "paralysed" by witnessing "silver" alien beings with "three triangular-shaped heads". The star told the Apple Fitness+ podcast that one of the otherworldly creatures touched her during the encounter, while sleeping in a friend's car during her early years in California, and "it felt like the finger of God".

question_sentence: Horror movie "Five Nights at Freddy's" broke box-office records by earning how much in its opening weekend?
evidence: The adaptation of the popular 2014 video game earned $78 million domestically and a further $52 million in other countries worldwide, despite getting poor reviews and being released simultaneously on the Peacock streaming service. According to makers Universal and Blumhouse, the movie broke a string of box-office records including the biggest Halloween weekend opening of all time.

question_sentence: Which country is now the sole bidder to host the 2034 Fifa World Cup?
evidence: The Middle East country became the de facto front-runner to host the 2034 tournament after Australia pulled out hours before Fifa's "declarations of interest" deadline on Tuesday. The kingdom's "unprecedented investment" in sports in recent years "always seemingly intended to lead to this moment", said the BBC's sports editor Dan Roan.

question_sentence: Which royal this week swore allegiance to their country at a ceremony on their 18th birthday?
evidence: According to commentators, Spain has been gripped by "Leonormania", as the future queen embarks on a charm offensive to revive support for the monarchy following a string of royal scandals. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What is the name of the storm that has battered Britain this week?
evidence: Flights were grounded, with train services also disrupted and major incidents declared in parts of the UK, as the storm made landfall on Thursday. Tens of thousands of homes were left without power amid widespread flooding and damage, with 100mph-plus winds recorded.

question_sentence: Men who use what more than 20 times a day have a higher risk of low sperm count, according to a new study?
evidence: The research, outlined in the journal Fertility and Sterility, found "significant exposure-response trends" between decreased total sperm count and concentration, and "increasing frequency of mobile phone use". The analysis of data from 2,886 Swiss men aged 18 to 22 found that those who used their phones more than 20 times a day had a 21% decrease in sperm concentration compared with rare users.

question_sentence: What is the name of a fugitive Pennsylvania pig caught after 18 days on the run?
evidence: The elusive hog was eventually caught using a cinnamon bun filled with Benadryl, after a lengthy search by his human family. The pig's namesake even helped, with the actor posting social media pleas to "bring Kevin Bacon home". For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which African country did King Charles and Queen Camilla visit this week?
evidence: Charles became the first member of the British royal family to convey "sorrow" over Britain's violent repression of the Mau Mau uprising against colonial rule. At a State banquet in Nairobi on Tuesday, the King expressed "deepest regret" for the "wrongdoings of the past", but stopped short of an apology.

question_sentence: South Africa holds a total of how many Rugby World Cup titles after beating New Zealand in this year's tournament final?
evidence: The Springboks now hold the record for Rugby World Cup title wins following their 12-11 victory in last Saturday's final in Paris. Arch-rivals New Zealand have won the tournament three times.

question_sentence: Hundreds of foreigners were allowed to leave Gaza this week for the first time since the Israel-Hamas war began. To which country did they flee?
evidence: Injured Palestinians and hundreds of foreign nationals have started crossing from Gaza into Egypt, officials and Egyptian media said, in the first sanctioned exodus from the besieged enclave in weeks.

question_sentence: Which Republican presidential candidate recently dropped out of the 2024 race?
evidence: Former Vice President Mike Pence suspended his campaign for president amid lagging poll numbers and financial challenges.

question_sentence: Fans and Hollywood stars are paying tribute to actor Matthew Perry following his untimely passing. Which popular TV sitcom did Perry star in?
evidence: Matthew Perry was best known for his role as Chandler Bing on “Friends.”

question_sentence: Which type of products were removed from Target, Rite Aid, and CVS this week due to bacterial concerns?
evidence: At least 26 eye drop products are being removed from several large retailers over concerns they could lead to serious eye infections, the FDA said Monday.

question_sentence: Which popular lake in Europe was impacted by flooding this week?
evidence: A storm that brought heavy rain and violent winds to northern Italy Tuesday sent rapid floods through central Milan and caused Lake Como to breach its banks.

question_sentence: Which MLB team won the World Series this week?
evidence: The Texas Rangers won their first World Series title in franchise history, defeating the Arizona Diamondbacks.

question_sentence: What is the three-digit mental health crisis line in the US?
evidence: Millions have used the 988 mental health crisis line since its launch in 2022, a new study shows, but experts say the resource is far from reaching its full potential.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled nearly 2 million vehicles this week due to a fire risk?
evidence: Toyota recalled more than 1.8 million RAV4 vehicles. At issue is a fire risk from some replacement batteries, Toyota said in a statement.

question_sentence: Which university was recently fined over $37 million by the Biden administration for misrepresenting the cost of its doctoral programs?
evidence: The Biden administration issued a $37.7 million fine against Grand Canyon University Tuesday after a Department of Education investigation concluded that the private school in Phoenix misrepresented the cost of its doctoral degree programs.

question_sentence: In addition to Halloween, which holiday was celebrated this week?
evidence: Mexico’s Día de los Muertos, or Day of the Dead, is a yearly celebration to remember and honor loved ones who have died. Day of the Dead always starts on November 1 and ends on November 2.

question_sentence: What type of barbecue flavors does Mission BBQ offer at its locations?
According to Similarweb Digital Data, which clothing company is currently the most visited clothing website in the world, surpassing brands like Nike, H&M, and Zara?
Why will Winter WonderFest not be opening this year, according to the news article?
choices: Financial challenges led to the closure
It was not popular with the community
The event organizers wanted to change its location

question_sentence: What did the Canadian Food Inspection Agency find in the oysters from Future Seafoods, Inc. that led to the recall?
What necessitated the rescue of the man whose boat overturned in the Delaware River near Reedy Island?
choices: The boat may have been struck by another vessel
Inadequate safety equipment on the boat

question_sentence: What is the primary goal of the "safe surrender" event being held at the Kent County Courthouse in Dover, Delaware?
choices: To offer amnesty to all individuals with outstanding warrants
To provide financial assistance to those who cannot pay fines
To bring together various parties in one place to resolve warrants and capiases
To apprehend and detain individuals with outstanding warrants

question_sentence: Who is Wally, and why did he attend the Philadelphia Flyers' game against the Carolina Hurricanes?
choices: Wally is the Flyers' new mascot who was introduced at the game.
Wally is a professional hockey player for the Flyers.
Wally is an emotional support alligator who attended the game with his owner, Joseph Henney.
Wally is a popular singer who performed at the game's halftime show.

question_sentence: What was a fan dressed as during the Philadelphia 76ers' home opener, and what did their sign say?
choices: A basketball player with a sign saying "Trade Harden"
A vengeful killer from the movie Halloween with a sign saying "Bring me Harden"
A superhero with a sign saying "Go Sixers"
A celebrity with a sign saying "I love Philly"

question_sentence: Why did Buybuy Baby close in 2023?
choices: Bankruptcy of the parent company Bed Bath and Beyond
Decline in customer interest in baby products
High operating costs and low sales

question_sentence: What addition is Capriotti's making to its legendary flagship sandwich, The Bobbie, for the first time?
choices: Offering a hot version of The Bobbie
Selling side dishes of mashed red potatoes and gravy to go with The Bobbie
Introducing a vegetarian version of The Bobbie
